channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How B-2 Bombers Can Fly to Iran and Back
item.description: The U.S. crews involved in attacking the nuclear site at Fordo probably trained for years. But dropping 30,000-pound bombs was almost certainly a new ...

item.title: Trump’s Iran Diplomacy Failed. I Hope His Airstrike Succeeds.
item.description: Iran can’t be allowed to develop a nuclear weapon, but the president’s approach wasn’t the best way to prevent that.

item.title: A federal judge says training AI on copyrighted works is ‘fair use,’ but casts doubt on use of pirated materials
item.description: Training AI on books Anthropic bought is ok, but downloading pirated ones is not, judge says

item.title: U.S. Rivals Like China and Russia Celebrate Shutdown of Voice of America
item.description: The Trump administration is not just releasing its grip on the global megaphone but handing it off to its eager adversaries, foreign policy experts sa...

item.title: Crypto market bounces back after President Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran
item.description: The crypto market added 2% to its market cap between Monday night and Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Germany to Spend Record Amount on Its Military and Infrastructure
item.description: The increase was announced hours before a NATO meeting during which member countries are expected to agree to raise military spending to 5 percent of ...

item.title: Uber and Waymo are rolling out robotaxi services in Atlanta as competition heats up with Elon Musk’s Tesla
item.description: Waymo's driverless march into Atlanta comes just days after Tesla finally launched a limited robotaxi service in Austin.

item.title: Central Park Hits Its Hottest Temperature Since 2012
item.description: New York’s official temperature gauge hit 99 degrees on Tuesday afternoon. It could climb even higher.

item.title: Trump’s chip tariff threat sparks pushback from auto industry to tech
item.description: The possible levy of up to 25% has united rivals like Tesla, General Motors, and Ford in voicing reservations.

item.title: Emirates, Qatar Airways, and other major airlines are cancelling flights and halting routes amid uncertainty from U.S. strikes and a shaky Israel-Iran ceasefire deal
item.description: Airports and skies throughout the region have been on edge since Israel began the deadly war on June 13.

item.title: Democrats Forge Ahead With Efforts to Reach War Powers Vote Amid Shaky Cease-Fire
item.description: The Democrats pressing for a vote to require congressional approval for any further military action against Iran are proposing to narrow the measure t...

item.title: Live Updates: Cease-Fire Takes Hold After Trump Rebukes Israel and Iran
item.description: President Trump lashed out at both countries for launching attacks after his cease-fire announcement. Comments by Israel’s military and Iran’s preside...

item.title: 15-Hour Qantas Flight Takes Passengers From Perth to Perth Amid Mideast Closures
item.description: Flights on Monday and Tuesday were delayed and diverted because of temporary air space closures in the region.

item.title: The Middle East tries to untangle travel after attacks and airspace closures.
item.description: Nearly half of all Qatar Airways flights were canceled on Tuesday, causing headaches and confusion around the world.

item.title: Germany to Spend Record Amount on Its Military and Infrastructure
item.description: The increase was announced hours before a NATO meeting during which member countries are expected to agree to raise military spending to 5 percent of ...
